intro: Actinodaphne novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea actinodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and the plant plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
